isis.stitle: TSI 95-12-06 - Service Manual Correction For Proper Cylinder Sleeve Installation Procedure

subjectgroup.subject: Service Manual Correction For Proper Cylinder Sleeve Installation Procedure

svcproc.title: DESCRIPTION
svcproc.para: An incorrect procedure has been identified in Service Manuals EGES 105 and EGES 105-1 for the DT-408, DT-466 and the International® 530 diesel engines. Section 6, pages 26 and 27 specify the use of lubriplate for lubricating the cylinder sleeve O-Rings and crankcase lower counterbore prior to sleeve installation. This practice could lead to problems described below. Refer to the next sections for service manual corrections. Replace these corrected sections in your service manuals and advise all service technicians of the correct procedure.

THE USE OF LUBRIPLATE OR ANY OTHER TYPE OF GREASE IN THE SLEEVE O-RING AREA IS NOT RECOMMENDED.
Lubriplate and grease have thick consistencies and are NOT able to escape from between the O-Rings during sleeve installation. Use of lubriplate or grease can result in a grease bound condition between the O-Rings thereby causing the sleeve to distort and lead to cylinder scoring.

important.para: USE CLEAN ENGINE OIL ONLY FOR LUBRICATING THE SLEEVE O-RINGS AND LOWER COUNTERBORE AREAS.

svcproc.para: Difficult sleeve insertion into the lower counterbore is an indication of incorrect size, twisted, out of position or lubrication bound O-Rings. The sleeves should install by hand without extreme effort. If difficult sleeve insertion is encountered or there is any question of distortion at the lower counterbore area, inspection of the sleeve bore with a dial bore indicator is recommended. Out of round or tapered condition beyond specified limits is not acceptable and can cause cylinder scoring. If any of these conditions are encountered the sleeve must be removed and the cause of distortion corrected.

para.emph: THIS PROCEDURE APPLIES TO ALL INTERNATIONAL WET SLEEVED ENGINES.

svcproc.title: CONNECTING RODS, PISTONS & RINGS - Continued
svcproc.para:
2. Assemble the piston and connecting rod as follows: Refer to
Figure 6.41.

item.para: Lubricate the connecting rod piston pin bushing with clean engine oil.
Install the retaining ring at one end of the piston pin bore.
Insert the connecting rod into the piston aligning bored holes of the rod and piston (the short side of the split on the crank end of the rod is to be toward the side of the piston marked "CAMSIDE").
Align the pin bores and insert the piston pin.

note.para: Connecting rod and cap matching numbers must be opposite the camside of the piston.

step1.para:
Lubricate the O-Rings with clean engine oil and install one into each cylinder sleeve groove (without twist). Refer to
Figure 6.42.

note.para: Lightly lubricate O-Ring area of sleeve and lower counterbore of crankcase with clean engine oil to ease installation and avoid O-Ring twist or pinch. DO NOT USE GREASE OR LUBRIPLATE.
Each cylinder sleeve uses two (2) O-Rings.

step1.para: If required, assure the proper shim(s) is installed, in the crankcase counterbore, so cylinder sleeve protrusion is within specifications. Refer to "CYLINDER SLEEVE FITTING PROCEDURE", (Figure 6.4).
Be sure the O-Rings are properly aligned in the groove.

Apply clean engine oil to the lower crankcase counterbore, then carefully install cylinder sleeve. If reusing sleeve, rotate 90° from its original position and install in the same bore from which it was removed. Refer to
Figure 6.43.

note.para: The sleeve should be installed by hand with no resistance felt. If a resistance is felt or if there is any question of distortion at the lower counterbore area, inspect the sleeve bore with a dial bore indicator. Any distortion, out-of-round or tapered condition is not acceptable and can cause cylinder scoring.

step1.para: After installation, check cylinder sleeve protrusion. Refer to "Reconditioning".
Lubricate the piston rings with clean engine oil and stagger the ring gaps 120° apart.
Install the piston ring compressor ZTSE4395 (DT-408/466) or ZTSE4396 (International® 530) over the piston rings.
Lubricate cylinder sleeve with clean engine oil.

note.para: The piston and rod assemblies can be installed by turning the crankshaft three (3) times. Position the Nos.1 and 6 crankpins at BTDC. Install Nos.1 and 6 piston assemblies. Repeat this procedure for the Nos. 2 and 5 and Nos. 3 and 4 piston and rod assemblies.

step1.para: Insert piston and connecting rod assembly into sleeve. The numbers on connecting rod must face away from camshaft while markings on top of piston faces toward the camshaft side of the engine.

Push piston and connecting rod into the cylinder sleeve with a wooden or plastic handle
(Figure 6.44)
.
Guide the connecting rod into place on the crankshaft.
